result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle L. Steinert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle L. Steinert

records.addlTxt: emailed dispatch - turned over to SDC

Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:20
State moves to amend to ord poss paraphernalia- Granted - No contest plea on behalf of defendant - Court finds guilty and imposes $263.50 - Hogan to notify her client  Review hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
PC from defendant - moved out of area and has no way of getting to court- advised her to notify us in writing of address change and referred her to her PD
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:50 pm - Defendant Danielle L. Steinert in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

01:29 pm - Defendant Danielle L. Steinert in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to non-apperance on 7-6-15.  Defendant states was transferred from Oneida County to Outagamie County.  Paperwork/Bond form taken and was not given back to defendant - Did not know what day court was.  Defendant states spoke with someone from the PD's office while in Outagamie County and was told someone would contact her.  Did not receive a call from the PD office.  Court directs defendant to contact PD's office in Rhinelander.  Court reinstates bond.  Warrant quashed - not yet issued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
03:03 pm - Defendant Danielle L. Steinert not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests and Court authorizes warrant.

02:01 pm - Defendant Danielle L. Steinert in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
